I always considered steeping to be almost the same as home made extract "steeping".(i'm not sure what they call it)
They take a fruit/nut and throw it in a jar with vodka and store it for a long time in the dark. Slowly the vodka absorbs flavor. Some people also use VG as a substitute for vodka.

Without having to spend too much money, you can try recording with a phone that records in HD, just don't hold it up to the TV, stack some books or something and have it propped up nice and centered.

Haha awesome, thanks! But seriously, I don't think I'll ever stop cooking eggs that way, foul bachelor frog style; eat right out of the mug!

I cooked an egg in the microwave, just throw it in a coffee cup with a dash of milk. Give it a good stir with a fork and microwave it for a minute. Then give it another good stir to scramble it and throw it in again for 30 seconds. You could get like bits of ham or cheese or whatever(you can afford...) and add it too.

I think maybe a Novel explaining the connection between all the games, officially linking them, so we're not just left with speculation on the relationship between characters/worlds. It could be a game too I guess, i'm not sure that story would fit in a game but if they wanted to I wouldn't appose.
[Itoi actually got a guy to write a couple of books for him before.](http://earthboundcentral.com/merchandise/earthbound-mother-books-novels/)

The first one probably lays out the story much better than the others, it's just opinion though on which is better.
Most of us started on Mother 2/earthbound. You can start on mother 1 but it's harder unless you get the patch/fix. This sometimes drives away people because they don't enjoy the game and end up not playing 2 or 3.

It was a few years ago but I think it was No$GBA. The only setting I changed was to make it fullscreen.
I'm pretty sure I didn't have any lag because once I learned the music I was able to pull off 12-16 hits consistently.

It takes an amazing monitor to have even only a couple of frames off! CRT would be best but if your not having a tourny for money i'm sure it will be ok.
[Check out this boring video comparing the delay on some higher end monitors.](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=wQQgHYnPiFs) ( A CRT is thrown in there for comparison )

I played thru it with a gba emulator on my pc, worked perfectly for me.
I can see people having lag trying to play on phones though.
